definition: tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
item/component/classifier for events, things, clothes etc

sentences.english: Things explode. These are the emergencies and disasters that we have nightmares about.
sentences.chinese: 噩夢般的緊急事件與災難這樣的事情不勝枚舉。

sentences.english: There's nothing like an emergency at work to spice up another routine day at the office.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼例行工作比得上辦公室裏遇到的緊急事件了。

sentences.english: Oversleeping is NOT regarded as an emergency.
sentences.chinese: 睡過頭不等同緊急事件。

sentences.english: After two days, no emergencies have come up.
sentences.chinese: 兩天之後，沒有緊急事件發生。

sentences.english: When you work at the frontline, you should be prepared to deal with emergencies.
sentences.chinese: 當你在一線工作時，需要隨時準備好處理緊急事件。

sentences.english: Are there emergency exits signs that are equipped with emergency lights?
sentences.chinese: 那些緊急事件出口標誌是否裝備有應急燈？

sentences.english: He noted that the emergency occurred in the Moscow time 9:23.
sentences.chinese: 他指出，該緊急事件發生在莫斯科時間9點23分。

definition: (jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
to dismiss with severance pay/to pay sb off

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
an express train sets off/fig. to work in haste/to rush
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
